{"step_by_step_thinking": "The IX, X, and XI cranial nerves are the glossopharyngeal, vagus, and accessory nerves, respectively. These nerves are involved in functions such as swallowing, speech, and shoulder movements. The nucleus ambiguus in the medulla oblongata of the brainstem gives rise to the motor fibers of these nerves, which control these functions.", "answer_choice": "B. Nucleus ambiguus"}
